title: Why does Trundle have such a bad winrate?
body:

Yo he's like trynd but tankier (and thus the same counter works). Quick trades in which he is cc'd for the entire duration.

He's a short ranged, no hard engage slow/speed up based champion. Ofc you're not gonna out duel him, but you can poke/short trades (you'll only win short trades if he doesn't get his q off, which'll be hard, but possible).

He has a bad win rate cause all the noobs are playing him after they saw him back in LCS. They think "oh hes in lcs he must be op" so they spammed trundle support without even having a clue why LCS used him as support to begin with. Hence the win rate drops
Trundle is an excellent jungler still. His incredibly healthy clears, powerful early game, and 80% AS buff make him a prime candidate for Bloodrazor BoRK.
he is strong against all melee tanks and brusiers, but the meta now is ranged top laner like gnar kennen jayce.

Trundle is a good duelist but not that great in team fights. If there's no dedicated tank on the enemy team his ult isnt that great outside of a 1v1. His pillar is great for jungle fights but it's pretty lackluster in open fights.

Trundle's win rate pretty closely follows tank metas as a result. Since we are in a carry meta he doesn't fair too well

he doesnt suck. he pretty much beats any melee 1v1 in lane and wins lane against any of them and can still duel them late game while having okay team fighting due to ult.

however ranged top laners rek him. we have a meta of full squish comps. he cant ult anyone to get a lot of stats

Well, first of all, Quinn and Kayle aren't common picks. They are just good picks at the moment. Also, Kennen and Jayce really didn't start popping up more often until they were used in pro play very often, which is relatively recent. Trundle mainly has a bad win rate Top because the Jugg update made his previous lane strengths less notable in Top Lane. He can still steal stats and have his Pillar, but everything he can do offensively can basically be done better by someone else. It is better to put him in a position that doesn't make your team have one less super damage threat.
Also, he is just not as good when you use him without a team. His ult isn't super apparent unless pointed out, so teams make better use of it. Also, his pillar is something that only teams really make good use of and can communicate proper placement of it.

The reason for Trundle being bad in solo queue is, well, solo queue.

His main assets (Pillar, tank-destroying ult) are much more useful in coordinated play, and he received nerfs for his strengths in that field. In solo queue, he cannot go toe-to-toe with a lot of the popular picks (he has losing match-ups against the 10 most popular top laners). Btw, of those 10 most popular tops, only 1 is ranged and 1 is pseudo-ranged, so I would not say we are in a ranged meta - at least not in solo queue.
Meta just doesn't favor him right now, with ranged pokers being popular top, the second tank meta comes back (that is a good joke there) he will be relevant again top
